citation.article-title: Acidobacterium capsulatum gen. nov., sp. nov.: an acidophilic chemoorganotrophic bacterium containing menaquinone from acidic mineral environment

p.s: Description of Acidobacterium capsulatum sp. nov.
Acidobacterium capsulatum (cap.su.la'tum capsula a small chest,capsule;L.M.masc.adj, capsulatum capsuled)
Gram-negative, aerobic, non-spore-forming, rod-shaped (0.3-0.8 by 1.1-2.3 μm), and capsulated bacteria.
The colonies of GYE gellan gum plate are circular (3.5-4.0 mm), smooth, translucent, mucous, and produces insoluble pale orange to orange pigment.
They grow at pH 3.0-6.0, but not at 6.5.
They give positive results in tests for esculin hydrolysis, β-galactosidase, and catalase.
Growth occurs at 25-37°C, but not at 42°C.
Growth does not occur in the presence of 3.5% NaCl.

Chemoorganotrophs; D-glucose, L-arabinose, D-xylose, D-galactose, D-mannose, maltose, arbutin, ceUobiose, starch, and β-gentiobiose are utilized as a sole carbon source, but not methanol, ethanol, glycerol, mannitol, and sorbitol.
Elemental sulfur and ferrous iron are not used as an energy source.
Growth is inhibited with 0.25 mM acetate.
The DNA base composition is 59.7-60.8 G+C mol%.
The major isoprenoid quinone is menaquinone with eight isoprene units.
The major fatty acid of cells is 13-methyltetradecanoic acid.
Strain 161 is the type strain of Acidobacterium capsulatum and has been deposited with the Japan Collection of Microorganisms as JCM 7670.
